results.title: Where the forest meets the sea (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jeannie Baker, Don Ezard, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This is a story set in North Queensland about a child’s exploration of an ancient coastal rainforest. Using a unique relief collage artform, the animated film takes the viewer on an extraordinary visual journey through the Daintree Forest. The film ends inquiringly with a reflection on the future of our few remaining and special untouched natural places, and it provides an excellent introduction for children of all ages to the understanding of the necessity for conservation of rainforests. Based on the award winning picture

results.title: Where small wings fly
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of the Queensland Bush Pilot Airways, the type of aircraft used, the base for operations, the services provided by the company, and the advantages of using the Bush Airways.
results.description: Describes the establishment of the Queensland Bush Pilot Airways, the type of aircraft used, the base for operations, the services provided by the company, and the advantages of using the Bush Airways.

results.title: Where she belongs...
results.creator_credit: Nikki Butler, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nikki Butler pays tribute to her Nana, a strong, knowledgeable Aboriginal women. Despite being a part of the Stolen Generation and growing up away from her land, Nana has taught Butler so much about her heritage, culture and land. Butler hopes to be with her when Nana does finally return home.

results.title: Where rainbows meet: Fairy Springs, Rotarua, New Zealand
results.brief_description: Item 1. Where rainbows meet. Fairy Springs, Rotorua New Zealand. Feeding rainbow trout (by hand) in crystal spring near Rotorua. Item 2. Who’s who at the zoo. Item 3. Nature’s Power House in NZ Geyserland — in Wairakei. Geyser Valley - boiling mud. Item 4. Gannet City - Cape Kidnappers N. Z. Item 5. Lake of a Thousand Isles - Lake Manapouri, NZ.

results.title: Where oranges grow
results.creator_credit: Jean Richards, Nandor Jenes, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Describes the life of a boy living on an orange grove near the Murray River, close to Mildura. Shows orchard activities and outlines the early history of orchards in the area.

results.title: Where my heart lies
results.creator_credit: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Where Mrs. Whalley lives
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, John Howe and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A study of the conflict between generations that can arise despite the best efforts of everyone to avoid it. Mrs. Whalley is an aging grandmother who lives with her son’s family, and sometimes it becomes a strain to hide hurt and loneliness for the sake of harmony in her son’s home. Cast includes Maude Whitmore, Leslie Yeo, Doug Chamberlin, Jean Caval.
